quest: Who made himself king without David knowing it?
ans: Adonijah the son of Haggith and David

quest: What did Bathsheba do under the guidance of Nathan?
ans: She met with David and reminded him that he had promised to make Solomon king.

quest: Who under David’s instruction was appointed king of Israel?
ans: Solomon

quest: Upon hearing this, what did Adonijah do?
ans: He caught hold on the horns of the altar

quest: Who did David charge Solomon to put to death?
ans: Joab and Shimei

quest: How many years did David reign as king?
ans: Forty

quest: For what request was Adonijah put to death?
ans: He requested Abishag the Shunammite be given to him as a wife

quest: Who killed Joab and was put over Solomon’s army?
ans: Benaiah

quest: Who was put in the priesthood as a replacement for Abiathar?
ans: Zadok

quest: Who else did Benaiah kill?
ans: Shimei

quest: Who did Solomon marry?
ans: he daughter of Pharaoh king of Egypt

quest: What opportunity was given to Solomon when the Lord appeared to him?
ans: To ask of the Lord what he wanted

quest: For what did Solomon ask?
ans: An understanding heart to judge God’s people and to discern between good and bad

quest: In addition to Solomon’s request, what else did the Lord say would be given to him?
ans: Riches, and honor

quest: What incident demonstrated the wisdom that God gave Solomon?
ans: He determined which of the women was the mother of the child

quest: Who supplied provisions for Solomon?
ans: Twelve officers over all Israel, each man his month in a year made provision

quest: How did Solomon’s wisdom compare to others?
ans: Solomon's wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east country, and all the wisdom of Egypt. For he was wiser than all men

quest: How many proverbs and songs did Solomon speak?
ans: Three thousand proverbs: and his songs were a thousand and five

quest: Of what other subjects did Solomon speak?
ans: Trees, beasts, fowl, creeping things, and of fishes.

quest: From where did people come to hear Solomon’s wisdom?
ans: From all kings of the earth

quest: What did Solomon request from Hiram, king of Tyre?
ans: Timber from cedar trees

quest: What was Solomon to do for Hiram?
ans: Give to Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat and twenty measures of pure oil each year

quest: How many Israelites did Solomon use to prepare materials for the temple?
ans: 30,000 to work in Lebanon, 70,000 to bare burdens, 80,000 hewers in the mountains, and 3,300 supervisors.

quest: How many years after Israel left Egypt did Solomon begin to build the temple?
What were the dimensions of the temple?
ans: Length 60 cubits, breadth 20 cubits, height 30 cubits

quest: What was built around the temple?
ans: Chambers

quest: What sound was not heard in the temple during the construction?
ans: The sound of neither hammer nor ax nor any tool of iron

quest: What did the Lord promise Solomon if he kept God’s statutes?
ans: God would dwell among the children of Israel, and not forsake them

quest: Of what material was the inside of the temple overlaid?
ans: Pure gold

quest: How many years did it take to build the temple?
ans: Seven

quest: How many years did it take to build Solomon’s house?
ans: Thirteen

quest: Who did the metal work for the temple?
ans: Hiram out of Tyre, who was a widow's son of the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a worker in brass

quest: What did Solomon bring to the temple when it was finished?
ans: The things which David had dedicated; even the silver, the gold, and the vessels

quest: What did the priests bring to the temple?
ans: The ark of the LORD, the tabernacle of the congregation, and all the holy vessels that were in the tabernacle

quest: What filled the temple when the priests came out of the holy place?
ans: The glory of the LORD

quest: What could not contain God?
ans: The heaven and heaven of heavens and much less the temple

quest: What did Solomon request of the Lord when people prayed toward the temple?
ans: To hear from heaven and forgive

quest: What did Solomon want all the peoples of the earth to know?
ans: That the LORD is God, and that there is none else

quest: How many animals did Solomon offer at the dedication of the temple?
ans: 22,00 oxen, and 120,000 sheep

quest: What did Solomon build at Ezion-Geber?
ans: A navy of ships

quest: Whose sailors served in the same fleet with Solomon’s men?
ans: Hiram’s  shipmen that had knowledge of the sea

quest: What did the Queen of Sheba say when she saw the achievements and wisdom of Solomon?
ans: The half was not told me: your wisdom and prosperity exceeds the fame which I heard

quest: How much gold did Solomon receive each year?
ans: 666 talents of gold

quest: Of what materials did Solomon make his throne?
ans: Ivory overlaid with the best gold

quest: Why weren’t any of Solomon’s vessels made of silver?
ans: Silver wasn’t worth much because Solomon made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones

quest: How did the riches and wisdom of Solomon compare to other kings?
ans: Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth for riches and for wisdom.

quest: How many chariots and horsemen did Solomon have?
ans: 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horsemen

quest: How many wives and concubines did Solomon have?
ans: Seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines

quest: Why was the LORD angry with Solomon?
ans: Because his heart was turned from the LORD and built high places, burnt incense and sacrificed to the gods of his strange wives

quest: What did the LORD say would happen to the kingdom?
ans: God would rend the kingdom from Solomon, and will give it to his servant

quest: Who were Solomon’s adversaries?
ans: Hadad the Edomite and Rezon the son of Eliadah

quest: With what object did Ahijah the prophet illustrate to Jeroboam that he would become king of ten tribes?
ans: By tearing Jeroboam’s new garment in twelve pieces and giving him ten

quest: When would this division of the kingdom occur?
ans: After Solomon’s son began to reign

quest: Who tried to kill Jeroboam?
ans: Solomon

quest: How long did Solomon reign in Jerusalem?
ans: Forty years

quest: Who reigned as king after Solomon died?
ans: Rehoboam his son

quest: What did Jeroboam request of Rehoboam?
ans: Make the grievous service of Solomon, and his heavy yoke which he put on us, lighter, and we will serve you

quest: Whose advice did Rehoboam reject?
ans: The old men

quest: What advice did Rehoboam follow?
ans: The advice of the young men who advised him to add to the yoke and chastise with scorpions rather than whips

quest: What did Israel do to Adoniram, who was over Solomon’s laborers?
ans: They  stoned him with stones

quest: Who did Israel make as their king?
ans: Jeroboam

quest: Why did Jeroboam set up golden calves at Bethel and Dan?
ans: Because he was afraid if the people went to Jerusalem to worship they might turn again to Rehoboam and kill him

quest: What did the man of God from Judah prophesy against Jeroboam’s altar?
ans: A child would be born to the house of David, Josiah by name; and on the altar he would offer the priests of the high places that burn incense on it, and men's bones shall be burnt on it. Also, the altar would be rent, and the ashes would be poured out

quest: What happened to Jeroboam when he ordered the man of God to be seized?
ans: His hand, which he put forth against him, dried up

quest: Why did the man of God refuse Jeroboam’s invitation?
ans: Because God had told him to eat no bread, nor drink water, nor turn again by the same way that you came

quest: How did the old prophet at Bethel persuade the man of God to come to his house?
ans: Because he said he was a prophet also; and claimed an angel spoke to him, saying, to bring him back to his house to eat bread and drink water. But he lied to him

quest: What happened to the man of God?
ans: A lion met him on his way home and slew him

quest: What was the sin of the house of Jeroboam that led to its downfall?
ans: He made of the lowest of the people priests of the high places

quest: What did Jeroboam tell his wife to do?
ans: Disguise herrself, and go to Ahijah the prophet, and find out what would become of their sick child.

quest: What did the Lord reveal to the prophet Ahijah?
ans: That Jeroboam’s wife would be coming and to tell her that God would bring evil on the house of Jeroboam and that the child would die.

quest: What would happen to Israel?
ans: Israel would be smitten and scattered

quest: How corrupt did Judah become?
ans: They built high places, images, and groves, allowed sodomites in the land: and they did according to all the abominations of the nations which the LORD cast out before the children of Israel

quest: What did Shishak king of Egypt do?
ans: He took away the treasures of the house of the LORD the treasures of the king's house, and he took away all the shields of gold which Solomon had made

quest: What did Rehoboam substitute for the treasures that were taken from the temple?
ans: Brass shields

quest: What can be said of Abijah’s three year reign as king of Judah?
ans: He walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him: and his heart was not perfect

quest: How did Asa do in his forty-one year reign over Judah?
ans: Asa did that which was right in the eyes of the LORD.  He took away the sodomites and removed all the idols that his fathers had made

quest: How did Nadab do in his two year reign over Israel?
ans: He did evil in the sight of the LORD

quest: How did Baasha become king of Israel?
ans: Baasha slew Asa, and reigned in his stead

quest: What can be said of Baasha’s twenty-four year reign as king of Israel?
ans: He smote all the house of Jeroboam according to Ahijah’s prophecy but he still did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of Jeroboam

quest: Who prophesied against Baasha?
ans: Jehu the son of Hanani

quest: How did Zimri become king?
ans: Zimri went in and smote Elah the son of Baasha, and killed him and reigned in his stead

quest: How many days did Zimri reign as king of Israel?
ans: Seven

quest: How did Omri do in his twelve year reign as king over Israel?
ans: Omri worked evil in the eyes of the LORD, and did worse than all that were before him

quest: What city did Omri build?
ans: Samaria

quest: How did Ahab do in his twenty-two year reign over Israel?
ans: Ahab the son of Omri did evil in the sight of the LORD above all that were before him

quest: Who did Ahab marry?
ans: Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Zidonians

quest: How was Joshua’s prophecy fulfilled when Jericho was rebuilt?
ans: It appears that two of his sons died as was prophesied

quest: What did Elijah tell would not happen for the next three years?
ans: Dew or rain

quest: How was Elijah fed during this time?
ans: Ravens fed him

quest: What did Elijah ask the widow of Zarephath to do for him?
ans: Bring him a little water in a vessel and a morsel of bread

quest: What miracle of provision did the LORD perform for the widow?
ans: The barrel of meal did not waste, neither did the cruse of oil fail, until the day that the LORD sent rain on the earth.

quest: What other miracle did the LORD perform for the widow?
ans: Raised the woman’s son from the dead.

quest: What did the LORD tell Elijah to do?
ans: Show himself to Ahab

quest: What did Obadiah do when Jezebel was killing the LORD’s prophets?
ans: He took an hundred prophets, and hid them by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water

quest: Why was Obadiah afraid to tell Ahab that Elijah was there?
ans: He was afraid that the Spirit of the LORD would carry Elijah somewhere and when he told Ahab, and Ahab could not find Elijah that Ahab would kill him

quest: What did Ahab call Elijah?
ans: He that troubles Israel

quest: How many false prophets came up against Elijah on Mt. Carmel?
What did Elijah ask the people of Israel?
ans: How long halt you between two opinions? if the LORD be God, follow him: but if Baal, then follow him.

quest: What would be the sign of the one true God?
ans: The God that answers by fire

quest: How long did Elijah give the prophets of Baal to call on their god?
ans: From morning until the time of the evening sacrifice

quest: How much water did Elijah pour on his sacrifice and wood?
ans: Twelve barrels

quest: Why did Elijah want God to answer his prayer?
ans: For it to be known that The LORD is God in Israel, and that he was God’s servant, and that he did all these things at God’s word

quest: What did they do to the prophets of Baal?
ans: Slew them

quest: What did Elijah hear?
ans: A sound of abundance of rain

quest: What sign was given to Elijah’s servant that it was going to rain?
ans: A little cloud out of the sea, like a man's hand

quest: How fast did Elijah run?
ans: Faster than Ahab rode

quest: Why did Elijah flee from Jezebel?
ans: She was wanting to kill him for killing her prophets

quest: For what did Elijah pray?
ans: That he might die

quest: Who provided food for Elijah giving him strength to get to Horeb?
ans: An angel of the LORD

quest: What question did the LORD twice ask Elijah?
ans: What do you here, Elijah?

quest: How did the LORD speak to Elijah?
ans: With a still small voice

quest: How did the LORD respond to Elijah’s statement that he was the only one left of the LORD’s prophets?
ans: I have left me seven thousand in Israel, all the knees which have not bowed to Baal

quest: Who did the LORD tell Elijah to anoint?
ans: Hazael to be king over Syria: Jehu to be king over Israel: and Elisha to be prophet in Elijah’s place

quest: What was Elisha doing when Elijah found him?
ans: Plowing with twelve yoke of oxen before him

quest: What did Elisha do to his yoke of oxen and plowing equipment?
ans: He took a yoke of oxen, slew them, and boiled their flesh with the instruments of the oxen, and gave to the people to eat.

quest: Who threatened to take Ahab’s wives, children, silver and gold?
ans: Benhadad the king of Syria

quest: Why did the LORD give Ahab victory over Ben-Hadad?
ans: Because the Syrians said, The LORD is God of the hills, but he is not God of the valleys, therefore God delivered them that they would know who was the LORD

quest: For what did the prophet condemn Ahab?
ans: Because he let Benhadad go whom God appointed to utter destruction

quest: Why did Naboth refuse to sell Ahab his vineyard?
ans: Because he believed that the LORD forbid him from giving his inheritance to Ahab

quest: What did Jezebel have done to Naboth?
ans: She had false witnesses accuse Naboth of blaspheming and then had him stoned to death.

quest: What did Elijah prophesy about Ahab?
ans: In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth shall dogs lick Ahab’s blood

quest: What did Elijah prophesy would happen to Jezebel?
ans: The dogs would eat Jezebel by the wall of Jezreel

quest: Who was partly responsible for Ahab’s vile behavior?
ans: Jezebel

quest: Why was the disaster prophesied against Ahab delayed until his son?
ans: Because he humbled himself before God

quest: What did Ahab ask Jehoshaphat to do?
ans: To go with Ahab to battle to Ramothgilead

quest: What did Jehoshaphat first want to do?
ans: Inquire at the word of the LORD

quest: What did Ahab’s four hundred prophets tell Ahab to do?
ans: Go up against Ramothgilead to battle; for the LORD shall deliver it into the hand of the king

quest: Why did Ahab hate Micaiah?
ans: Because he did not prophesy good concerning Ahab, but evil.

quest: What did Micaiah say would happen to Israel?
ans: Israel would be scattered on the hills, as sheep that have not a shepherd

quest: What did Ahab order to be done to Micaiah?
ans: Put him in prison, and feed him with bread and water of affliction

quest: What happened to Ahab in the battle?
ans: He was smitten with an arrow and he died

quest: What did Jehoshaphat get rid of out of the land of Judah
ans: Sodomites

quest: What happened to Jehoshaphat’s ships?
ans: They were broken at Eziongeber

quest: How did Ahaziah do in his two year reign over Israel?
ans: He did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of his parents Ahab and Jezebel
